content.description: Sit start to the right of the detached block squeezing the two aretes.  Follow the finger crack and face holds up and right to the top.
content.location: Starts on the detached block on the back of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start in the overhang on an ok left hand edge and a sloper/bad-crimp thing. Move up and right to the gaston rail then a big move up left to slopers and a desperate finish. For an easier finish, bail right at the rail into often wet crack holds.
content.location: Climbs the center of the overhanging face (that faces the trail) between Bent Wheel and Gridlock.

content.description: V10? V-Impossible? Who knows? Project! This is the crazy overhanging v-groove. Sit start and muscle out the v-groove to an ok slot-hold at the end of the groove. Finish on thin face moves above to get onto the easy slab at the top.
content.location: The obvious v-groove on the east side of the boulder.

content.description: Prepare to shred some knuckles! Sit start left side of overhang below the thin, left-angling, crack. Slap left to slopers then jam the crack to the easy slab above.
content.location: Starts on the left side of the overhang (that faces the trail) below the left-angling crack.

content.description: Sit start at the flake. Pull over onto the easy slab above.
content.location: Starts at the flake below the low slab to the right of the big v-groove of the Impossible Problem.

content.description: Layback up the arete to access the finger crack. Perfect jams up over the bulge onto the slab above.
content.location: Located on the west side of the boulder. This is the finger crack that starts around 8 feet off the ground. There are two big detached blocks that sit at it's base.

content.description: Low start at good edge. Work up layback holds out right then up to slopers on the arete. Good holds from there up to the top. Tall!
content.location: Starts around the corner (to the left) from Classic Crack . Starts low on a good horizontal edge.

content.description: Awkwardly sit start the arete left of the Impossible Problem. Traverse right into the slot hold at the end of the v-groove and finish on thin face holds above.
content.location: Starts to the left of the Impossible Problem v-groove.

content.description: The biggest of the boulders in this area, it is home to the must-do crack climb "Classic Crack" and to the "Impossible Problem" (an undone project?).
